review_blob: Tried a bomber from Bestway GSO.  I was skeptical at first because the label mentioned the use of black patent malt, I figured, what the hell and bought it anyway.  The beer pours midnight black with plenty of carbonation.  The aroma is of faint roasted malt, no hops.  Mouthfeel is thick and oily and as I suspected the black patent malt drowns out most of the other ingredients.  Basically it shouldnt be called a black IPA.  Its more like a stout with too much hops.  I expected better after tasting the organic IPA last week.

Purchased a 22 from Bestway.  Pours black with an ample beige head.  Aroma is sweet, with hints of toasted malts and a coppery flavor.  A bit overly fizzy for a stout, also the mouthfeel is a little thin.  The flavor is overwhelmingly bittersweet coppery flavor throughout.  Very one-diminsional and puny for a beer that "captures the brawny spirit of the workers".

Pours amber with a slightly feeble tan head.  Mouthfeel is overly thin and lacking the dry finish of other belgian beers.  Taste is overly sweet, cidery and yeasty.  Seems like particularly weak in alcohol for a Belgian Red Ale.  Taste almost disappears from the palate after a few seconds.
Tried a 22oz. from Bestway.  Poured dark amber with a relatively thin feel.  Excellent piney and mint notes.  Very easy to drink.  Overall a nice subdued holiday beer.

Slightly stale/ yeasty nose with trace amounts of spices.  Thin mouthfeel close to many american pale lagers.  Hints of cinnamon and clove with barely any substantial hop presence.  Tasted like a spiced, old Budweiser.  Bought at Bestway in Greensboro for 6$.  Worst holiday beer Ive yet tried
